## Plot

2. Here, add a scatter plot of the iris data set depicting Sepal.Length and Sepal.Width
variables and print the figure and the code snippet.


```{r iris}

#data set
head(iris)

#assign variables
Sepal.Length<-iris[1:150,1]
Sepal.Width<-iris[1:150,2]

#create scatter plot
plot(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, xlab="sepal length", ylab="sepal width", pch=19)

```

## Formula

4. Here, add a formula which calculates the Toxic Unit of a concentration (ci) and and
EC50 value together with the corresponding text (see Markdown slides).

$$ sumTU=log_{10}\bigg(\sum\nolimits_{i=1}^n\bigg(\frac{c_{i}}{EC_{50_i}}\bigg)\bigg) $$
where $c_{i}$ is the concentration of the pesticide $i$ and $EC_{50_i}$ is the concentration of pesticide $i$ at which 50 % of the test organisms (_Daphnia magna_) were affected.
